creator: Juan_Sola@yahoo.com
text:
I have Fedora Core 6 with Kernel 2.6.16 and building a version of Apache with
TOE support for my dissertation.  I am only "hacking" the socket.c and
sendrecv.c.  The bug resides when you use ./configure --disable-ipv6 and then
run make. Libtool exits with an error.

There is a bug in ./srclib/apr/network_io/unix/multicast.c. Function
find_if_index(const apr_sockaddr_t *iface) is defined inside #if APR_HAVE_IPV6 
Line 168 of multicast.c is:

mip.gsr_interface = find_if_index(iface); 

This is OUTSIDE the #if APR_HAVE_IPV6 section therefore it is compiled as part
of IPV4.  I commented this instruction and Apache is working. I haven't study
its impact yet.  Please be WARN!
